definition: lit. to share the same bed with different dreams (idiom); ostensible partners with different agendas/strange bedfellows/marital dissension
like/same/similar/together/alike/with
(used in given names)/variant of 同[tong2]
see 衚衕|胡同[hu2 tong4]
bed/couch/classifier for beds/CL:張|张[zhang1]
variant of 床[chuang2]
different/other/hetero-/unusual/strange/surprising/to distinguish/to separate/to discriminate
dream/CL:場|场[chang2],個|个[ge4]/(bound form) to dream

sentences.english: Therefore I'll lie with love, and love with me.
sentences.chinese: 因而我和爱便同床异梦。
政治常制造一些奇怪的同床异梦者。

sentences.english: Even then, Beijing and Moscow look uncomfortable bedfellows.
sentences.chinese: 即便如此，中国和俄罗斯似乎也是同床异梦。

sentences.english: Crankishness aside, technocracy and autocracy have long been natural bedfellows.
sentences.chinese: 除了古怪之外，技术官僚和专制早就已经同床异梦。

sentences.english: The accumulation of the dispute, the husband and wife and estrangement from the alert, known as the "Strange Bedfellows ."
sentences.chinese: 纠纷的积累，夫妻从隔阂而戒备，俗称“同床异梦”。

sentences.english: Science and race have long been uneasy bedfellows.
sentences.chinese: 科学和种族长期以来一直同床异梦。

sentences.english: Unit testing and web applications to be unhappy bedfellows.
sentences.chinese: 单元测试和网络应用程序不快乐同床异梦。

sentences.english: Rampant free enterprise also lives uncomfortably alongside the country's official ideology.
sentences.chinese: 自由企业横行也与官方意识形态同床异梦。

sentences.english: The couple sleep in the same bed but dream different dreams.
sentences.chinese: 这对夫妻同床异梦，各有各的打算。

sentences.english: Are you cooking with another one with the endless pain from your heart?
sentences.chinese: 在心中充满无尽痛苦时，你还在与人同床异梦吗？

sentences.english: Though the couple have had years of marriage, they have a sense of strange bedfellows.
sentences.chinese: 这对夫妇虽已结婚多年，但有同床异梦之感。

definition: the appearance of unity, but divided at heart (idiom); seeming harmony belies underlying disagreement
husband and wife/married couple
to be estranged
to become enemies (idiom); to fall out with sb
to treat each other as an honored guest (idiom)/mutual respect between husband and wife
an unhappy couple (formal writing)
to share the bed/(fig.) to be married
lit. to take different roads and urge the horses on (idiom)/fig. to part ways
the shrike and the swallow fly in different directions (idiom)/(usually of a couple) to part from each other
mother-in-law and daughter-in-law
stuck together as by glue (of lovers)/joined at the hip
to quarrel/to fall out with sb
close relation, no gap (idiom); intimate and nothing can come between
lover/sweetheart
to moisten with spittle (idiom); sharing meager resources/mutual help in humble circumstances
lit. to lift the tray to eyebrow level (idiom); mutual respect in a marriage
